title: Hide fields
text: This does what it says in the app name, BUT there is a bug/quirk when editing the settings which is that it automatically adds a blank rule on the "Based on dropdown fields" tab, so if you are changing the rules we hve in the "based on user roles" tab, it errors when you save because of the incomplete default added rule. Therefore, delete the blank rule before saving. Error Fix

title: Jira User Permissions for integration with Freshdesk App
text: The Jira user configured in the Jira custom app is support@k3btg.com The configuration of how that user was set up and how to do the same for any other similar use-case from Arno Smulders on 12th July 2023 is: Create an invitation for a new user to Jira. (obviously for this kind of user, please contact the Jira admin to make sure he is aware of this special user) Go to User Management in Atlassian Administration In ‘Access requests’ grant the user access Freshdesk integration user needs to have and be part of the following access settings, roles and groups: Access: ‘Has access on site’ Jira Software Roles: Basic Groups: Jira-administrators Jira-software-users With the new user log in to the following page and create the API Token for this user (needed in the Freshdesk configuration) https://id.atlassian.com/manage-profile/security/api-tokens Click ‘Create API token’ Enter a Label that will identify the token and click ‘Create’. Make sure to store the created token, as after this screen it will not be visible anymore. If you lose it, you’ll need to create a new one. Next you need to provide accessibility per Jira project. Start by opening the desired project (https://k3btg.atlassian.net/jira/projects) There are 2 types of projects: Company and Team managed projects, each with slight differences. Company managed projects (ex Imagine). Open ‘Project settings’ Navigate to ‘People’ Click ‘Add people’ to add the newly created user. Select the user and grant it 2 roles: ‘Developers’ and ‘Stakeholder - Expanded’ Team managed projects (ex Viji) Open ‘Project settings’ Navigate to ‘Access’ Click ‘Add people’ to add the newly created user. Select the user and grant it the role: ‘Member’
description:
The Jira user configured in the Jira custom app is support@k3btg.com

The configuration of how that user was set up and how to do the same for any other similar use-case from Arno Smulders on 12th July 2023 is:


  1. Create an invitation for a new user to Jira. (obviously for this kind of user, please contact the Jira admin to make sure he is aware of this special user)
  2. Go to User Management in Atlassian Administration
  3. In ‘Access requests’ grant the user access
  4. Freshdesk integration user needs to have and be part of the following access settings, roles and groups:

Access:

  • ‘Has access on site’
  • Jira Software

Roles:

  • Basic

Groups:

Jira-administrators

Jira-software-users

  1. With the new user log in to the following page and create the API Token for this user (needed in the Freshdesk configuration) https://id.atlassian.com/manage-profile/security/api-tokens
  2. Click ‘Create API token’
  3. Enter a Label that will identify the token and click ‘Create’.
  4. Make sure to store the created token, as after this screen it will not be visible anymore. If you lose it, you’ll need to create a new one.

 

  1. Next you need to provide accessibility per Jira project. Start by opening the desired project (https://k3btg.atlassian.net/jira/projects)

There are 2 types of projects: Company and Team managed projects, each with slight differences.

  1. Company managed projects (ex Imagine). Open ‘Project settings’ 
  2. Navigate to ‘People’
  3. Click ‘Add people’ to add the newly created user.
  4. Select the user and grant it 2 roles: ‘Developers’ and ‘Stakeholder - Expanded’

 

  1. Team managed projects (ex Viji) Open ‘Project settings’ 
  2. Navigate to ‘Access’
  3. Click ‘Add people’ to add the newly created user.
  4. Select the user and grant it the role: ‘Member’

title: Recovery SLA (custom app)
text: The Recovery SLA app was developed by arbaan who are a subcontractor of Freshdesk. Attached is the help document they produced. If there is an issue with the custom app, please raise a request with support@freshdesk.com who contractually are obliged to facilitate having an issue fixed (but it will be chargeable - it's not included in Freshdesk support). FAQs As per the SOW, the toggle button's function is only to determine whether you want to notify the agent. When the toggle button is turned on, the agent will receive a notification for the private note, whereas if it's turned off, the agent will not be notified about the private note. However, it's important to note that a private note will be added automatically as the SLA time approaches, regardless of whether the toggle button is enabled or disabled. If you don't want to calculate the SLA recovery time when the ticket is resolved, you can add the resolved status in the "status for indicate to meet the recovery SLA" field.
description:
The Recovery SLA app was developed by arbaan who are a subcontractor of Freshdesk.  Attached is the help document they produced. If there is an issue with the custom app, please raise a request with support@freshdesk.com who contractually are obliged to facilitate having an issue fixed (but it will be chargeable - it's not included in Freshdesk support).


FAQs

As per the SOW, the toggle button's function is only to determine whether you want to notify the agent. When the toggle button is turned on, the agent will receive a notification for the private note, whereas if it's turned off, the agent will not be notified about the private note. However, it's important to note that a private note will be added automatically as the SLA time approaches, regardless of whether the toggle button is enabled or disabled.

If you don't want to calculate the SLA recovery time when the ticket is resolved, you can add the resolved status in the "status for indicate to meet the recovery SLA" field.
